intro: Glycosma occidentale, commonly known as the western glycosma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant features slender, erect stems that are often branched and covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and have a distinctive reddish or purple hue on the underside. The flowers are small, greenish-white, and arranged in clusters, contributing to its subtle aesthetic appeal.
